CAREREL_W27.question_text: How likely is it that, at some point in your life, you will be responsible for caring for an aging parent or family member?

PREDICTA_W27.question_text: Do you think the following will or will not happen in the next 20 years? Doctors will rely on computer programs to diagnose most diseases and determine treatments

PREDICTB_W27.question_text: Do you think the following will or will not happen in the next 20 years? Most stores and retail businesses will be fully automated and involve little or no human interaction between customers and employees

PREDICTC_W27.question_text: Do you think the following will or will not happen in the next 20 years? Most deliveries in cities will be made by robots or drones instead of humans

PREDICTD_W27.question_text: Do you think the following will or will not happen in the next 20 years? When people want to buy most common products, they will create them at home using a 3-D printer

CARS1_W27.question_text: How much have you seen or heard about the effort to develop driverless vehicles - that is, cars and trucks that can operate on their own without a human driver?

CARS3A_W27.question_text: How enthusiastic are you, if at all, about the development of driverless vehicles?

CARS3B_W27.question_text: How worried are you, if at all, about the development of driverless vehicles?

CARS4_W27.question_text: How long, if ever, do you think it will take for most of the vehicles on the road to be driverless, rather than driven by humans?

CARS5_W27.question_text: Would you, personally, want to ride in a driverless vehicle if you had the opportunity?

CARS7A_W27.question_text: How safe would you feel sharing the road with a driverless passenger vehicle?

CARS7B_W27.question_text: How safe would you feel sharing the road with a driverless freight truck?

CARS8_W27.question_text: If driverless vehicles become widespread, do you think that the number of people killed or injured in traffic accidents will increase, decrease, or stay about the same?

CARS9A_W27.question_text: Would you strongly favor, favor, oppose, or strongly oppose the following rules and regulations for driverless vehicles? Requiring them to travel in dedicated lanes

CARS9B_W27.question_text: Would you strongly favor, favor, oppose, or strongly oppose the following rules and regulations for driverless vehicles? Restricting them from traveling near certain areas, such as schools

CARS9C_W27.question_text: Would you strongly favor, favor, oppose, or strongly oppose the following rules and regulations for driverless vehicles? Requiring them to have a person in the driver's seat who could take control in an emergency situation

CARS10A_W27.question_text: If driverless vehicles become widespread, which of the following do you think are likely to happen as a result? Elderly and disabled people will be able to live more independently

CARS10B_W27.question_text: If driverless vehicles become widespread, which of the following do you think are likely to happen as a result? Many people who drive for a living would lose their jobs

CARS10C_W27.question_text: If driverless vehicles become widespread, which of the following do you think are likely to happen as a result? Owning a car would become much less important to people

CARS10D_W27.question_text: If driverless vehicles become widespread, which of the following do you think are likely to happen as a result? Most people would never learn how to drive a car on their own

CARS10E_W27.question_text: If driverless vehicles become widespread, which of the following do you think are likely to happen as a result? There would be much less traffic in major cities

WORK2_W27.question_text: On a different subject, would you say that society generally places too much importance on working and having a job, not enough importance on working and having a job, or is it just about right?

ROBJOB1_W27.question_text: Please consider the following scenario - in the future, robots and computers with advanced capabilities may be able to do most of the jobs that are currently done by humans today. How much have you heard, read, or thought about this idea before today?

ROBJOB2_W27.question_text: Based on what you know, does the idea of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future seem

ROBJOB3A_W27.question_text: How enthusiastic are you, if at all, about the possibility of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future, for society as a whole?

ROBJOB3B_W27.question_text: How worried are you, if at all, about the possibility of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future, for society as a whole?

ROBJOB4A_W27.question_text: Do you think the following are likely to happen as a result of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future? Inequality between rich and poor would be much worse than it is today

ROBJOB4B_W27.question_text: Do you think the following are likely to happen as a result of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future? People would have a hard time finding things to do with their lives

ROBJOB4C_W27.question_text: Do you think the following are likely to happen as a result of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future? People would be able to focus less on work and more on the things that really matter to them in life

ROBJOB4D_W27.question_text: Do you think the following are likely to happen as a result of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future? The economy as a whole would be much more efficient

ROBJOB4E_W27.question_text: Do you think the following are likely to happen as a result of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future? The economy would create many new, better-paying jobs for humans

ROBJOB4F_W27.question_text: Do you think the following are likely to happen as a result of robots and computers being able to do most of the jobs currently done by humans in the future? Humans would find their jobs more meaningful and fulfilling since machines would mostly be doing things that humans find unappealing

ROBJOB5B_W27.question_text: Would you favor or oppose the following? If robots and computers were mostly limited to doing jobs that are dangerous or unhealthy for humans to do

ROBJOB5C_W27.question_text: Would you favor or oppose the following? If people had the option of paying extra to interact with a human, rather than a robot or computer, when buying a product or service

ROBJOB5D_W27.question_text: Would you favor or oppose the following? If the federal government created a national service program that paid people to perform tasks even if a robot or computer could do those tasks faster or cheaper

MC_options: The government would have an obligation to take care of people whose jobs are displaced by robots and computers
Individuals would have an obligation to take care of their own financial well-being
ROBJOB6_W27.question_text: Which of the following statements best describes how you feel, even if neither is exactly right?

MC_options: If businesses can receive better work at lower cost by replacing humans with robots and computers
There should be limits on how many jobs businesses can replace with robots and computers
even if they can do those
ROBJOB7_W27.question_text: Which of the following statements best describes how you feel, even if neither is exactly right?

ROBJOB8A_W27.question_text: Do you think it is very likely, somewhat likely, not very likely, or not at all likely that the job of a software engineer will be mostly replaced by robots or computers in your lifetime?

ROBJOB8B_W27.question_text: Do you think it is very likely, somewhat likely, not very likely, or not at all likely that the job of a legal clerk will be mostly replaced by robots or computers in your lifetime?

ROBJOB8C_W27.question_text: Do you think it is very likely, somewhat likely, not very likely, or not at all likely that the job of a nurse will be mostly replaced by robots or computers in your lifetime?

ROBJOB8D_W27.question_text: Do you think it is very likely, somewhat likely, not very likely, or not at all likely that the job of a construction worker will be mostly replaced by robots or computers in your lifetime?

ROBJOB8E_W27.question_text: Do you think it is very likely, somewhat likely, not very likely, or not at all likely that the job of a fast food worker will be mostly replaced by robots or computers in your lifetime?

ROBJOB8F_W27.question_text: Do you think it is very likely, somewhat likely, not very likely, or not at all likely that the job of a teacher will be mostly replaced by robots or computers in your lifetime?

ROBJOB8G_W27.question_text: Do you think it is very likely, somewhat likely, not very likely, or not at all likely that the job of a insurance claims processor will be mostly replaced by robots or computers in your lifetime?

WORK5A_W27.question_text: Have you yourself ever lost a job because your employer replaced your position with a machine, robot or computer program?

WORK6_W27.question_text: Have you ever had your pay or hours reduced because your employer replaced some aspect of your job with a machine, robot or computer program?

WORK7_W27.question_text: Do you personally know anyone who has lost a job, or had their pay or hours reduced, because their employer replaced their work with a machine, robot or computer program?
